website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a powerful machine to clean particular areas of carpet, this is ideal.
pros: Flex hose and long reach cord make it easy to clean hard-to-reach areas
Features a stair tool and tough stain tool
Has a 22-foot power cord and 4-foot hose
cons: As the name implies, this is meant for small area cleaning only
not for cleaning entire floors of carpet

website_summaries.verdict: A top-quality spot cleaner with excellent extraction capabilities.
pros: Easy to use, excellent at getting out stains and odor (even pet stains), and powerful extraction
Versatile enough to use on different types of upholstery as well as carpeting
Recovery tank is easy to clean
cons: Some issues with parts breaking, such as hose and sprayer
A few feel it's loud and heavy

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet accidents
customer_reviews.text: I have five dogs, two of them are puppies so I really needed something that could clean pet accidents off my light carpet. I have tried every cleaner out there. The full size carpet cleaners are big and take too long for small accidents so I thought I would try this. I LOVE this thing. It gets out all pet stains with ease. I just had to include the before and after photos from when my puppy when diarrhea on the carpet. First I picked up what I could with a wet wipe which left an even bigger mess. Then I used the Bissell on it. Stain is GONE.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: This actually works
customer_reviews.text: I NEVER write reviews. However, this needs one. I bought this because my dog decided to pee all over my old bedroom with a white rug. I tried cleaning it three months ago with a scrub brush, warm water and a little carpet cleaner. Obviously it didn't work and stained. Randomly, I bought this BISSEL two nights ago to avoid this happening again...and it actually got up all the old stains from months ago! I am so shocked. Check out my pictures. This is definitely a great machines for animal owners, or clumsy people just spill here and there
customer_reviews.author: Rian

customer_reviews.title: Cracked hose
customer_reviews.text: Purchased October '15, was pleased with product until the hose recently cracked. I would say it's been used lightly, under ten times. I looked on the website and see that I cannot just order a replacement part so I will call today. UPDATE: Bissell is sending me a replacement so I added stars back for customer service. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: This unit works until the hose breaks where it connects ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit works until the hose breaks where it connects to the cleaning head - that happened to this unit. So, I duct taped it. That got me buy until the small cleaning head broke. So I switched to the large cleaning head. That worked until the handle broke where the cleaning head attaches to the handle. I bought the unit new in April and it first broke in October. No, I'm not hard on the machine. It just isn't built well in the hose and head assembly. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: It will break and you can't replace parts!
customer_reviews.text: Our hose has broken on both ends several times. We macguyvered it back together but it was never the same and you can't get a replacement part! Another thing went wrong with suction and we had to put a screw in where the water container connects to the machine to give it room to work. It is difficult to clean where it gets nasty as well. This is a throwaway product that we will never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor Crafty

customer_reviews.title: 2 machines, same issue... useless after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This is the second machine i’ve Received and with BOTH machines the hose sprayer stopped functioning. Like others mentioned, the customer service is a joke. I even researched online and bought parts that would supposedly fix problem but it’s still broken. So now it’s a very expensive wet vac. I have no interest in pouring more money into this piece of junk to get it fixed. Honestly, I think the reason it has a 4 star average is because people usually review after a couple uses, before it breaks shortly after.
customer_reviews.author: Kat-e-did

customer_reviews.title: Bad Hose. Ripped already.
customer_reviews.text: My hose already ripped. Poor quality hose. Everything is great but the hose really sucks. And the hose is hard and not easy to bend. Just through mine in the trash this morning after a year. Fix the hose problem bissel.
customer_reviews.author: KEV

customer_reviews.title: Great until the hose broke; bissell was no help
customer_reviews.text: I loved this vacuum until the hose broke. I only used it about 3 times a year and now it’s completely useless. Looks like many other reviewers have had the exact same problem. I hate how nothing ever seems last nowadays. The does not appear appear to be a replacement part either. Such a disappointment for what was a great wet vac. Update: I called Bissell and they referred me to a service center where the part was $60 plus installation. Great way to stand behind your product, Bissell. Won't be buying from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bernard

customer_reviews.title: I take good care of my appliances and make sure they are ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well the first two times I used it. Ever since it has started to leak water from the bottom of the device and the sprayer no longer works. I take good care of my appliances and make sure they are stored correctly and used correctly. For $120 this was a waste of money. Because I do not use this everyday it's hard to determine if a product will continue to work as it should. I rarely write reviews. Great concepts, leaking and not working after two uses, terrible.
customer_reviews.author: ErinP

customer_reviews.title: Cracked hose
customer_reviews.text: If you have pets and carpets, you need something like this. This cleaner worked great for 3 years. I give it 5 stars for size, convenience and cleaning. But like so many others my hose cracked. I had read a lot of other reviews before purchasing so I knew the hose would be a potential problem. So I totally babied the hose... never used the holder (which stretches a weak spot) and was always careful. And it still cracked. Now to see how long duct tape can extend the life... lol. Good luck
customer_reviews.author: mdurg

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: I opted out of buying a reburshed or returned one, because I would prefer a brand new one. When I received it you could blatantly tell it was a returned item none of the items were sealed properly and there was hair on both of the adapters. I was also disappointed with the suction. I did alot of research and thought this was the one. But I was wrong, maybe whoever returned it screwed it up. But just beware that they will try to pawn off a used one as new and lack of suction.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Love. Helpful review if you're going to buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge cloth sectional couch and it pulled up all the muck and stains! It's like I have a new couch! It's easy to use but makes a huge mess. If you're cleaning furniture I recommend putting down some towels on the floor before you start. Totally worth it though.each part comes apart easy to clean out dog hair. Be sure to go slow and over the area in all directions for the best clean. If it stops suction then it's because water is need and the tank should be emptied. FYI it comes with a small bottle cleaner formula if u want to try it before purchasing a combo. The stuff smell awesome though.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: The hoses turn yellow and break in about a year.
customer_reviews.text: I had two of these. One of this model and one cordless one. They were always a bit annoying as the reservoirs are goofy shaped and are not self standing (probably because of a patent). The biggest problem is that the hoses on both units yellowed, became brittle, and cracked off in less than a year on both units. They work ok while they last, but there are probably better designs out there.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible hose design.
customer_reviews.text: You can’t remove the hose to clean it. They say to just suck clean water through it, but I use this thing ~3 times a week (messy people, 3 animals, and white carpet) and occasionally forget. After less than a year of using it the hose is full of black mold and smells AWEFUL. Even if I didn’t forget the inside of the hose stays moist and is just a breeding ground. Having to throw the whole machine away is so wasteful when a detachable hose could fix it all.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this Bissell 3624 Spot Cleaner purely for our large sectional, in bad need of cleaning.... especially when you have 5 rescued dogs. We didn't want or need anything bigger, more expensive as we have tiles and wooden floors throughout the house. Don't be lazy, don't pull on it (lift it) follow the instructions carefully and you will be able to get your upholstery cleaned better than any professional can! It'll also do a fantastic job on all your rugs and even carpet stains. We love it , glad we made a decision to purchase and highly recommended it!! Thank you Amazon - not to mention excellent, fast service!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Grusenmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lil thing
customer_reviews.text: Im very pleased with this bad boy,from dog puke to my greasy hand prints on everything...i read a bunch of reviews that almost got me not to buy it....BUT i got it anyways and I couldn't be happier,just remember if you want it to last 1,rinse the dang thing out... 2,grab it by the head ,not the handle by the hose.. 3,rinse..........even the hose And for stairs sometimes its hard to get the corners all the way
customer_reviews.author: DUHFSH

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for a simple machine
customer_reviews.text: Machine works great but honestly for a total of $30 get yourself a good spray bottle, a stiff brush, cleaner of your choice (that you would use in this machine anyways) and use your home shop vac. All this does is spray solution, you scrub it yourself and then vaccum it up. May be nice for someone that does not have their own shop vac or want to bother cleaning their shop vac after using but after using it a few times, it just seems like a waste of money. For this price I would at least expect a power brush or internal heater.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 3 or 4 uses, then quit spraying. The suction still works fine, but now I have to mix my cleaner in a spray bottle then use the machine to scrub the dirty spot and suck up the cleaner. Too late to return by the time it quit working. Keep in mind that for such a small cleaner, it is just for small spills or small spots, so you won't use it frequently. At least I didn't need it often. Too bad it quit working with in 2 months of purchasing. By the way, I always emptied, rinsed out and dried both vessels after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great for old stains!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this product to clean my couch cushions over the weekend, and I was happily surprised! I figured that some of the stains would come up, but the older ones would never come out. I was WRONG!!! The stains on my couch were all from baby bottle/milk stains. Although we had wiped up the spills as they occurred, the milk had seeped into the cushions and left stains everywhere. I did occasionally let the detergent sit for 5-10 minutes and soak in on the worst of the stains before scrubbing. My couch looks brand new! I would recommend this product to anyone seeking a spot remover/shampooer.
customer_reviews.author: T. JONES

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: My first time having any type of home cleaner like this. I needed it for small spots (pet accidents), a large sofa, and a king mattress. Well, to do the mattress required putting the machine on the mattress, it leaked, and was difficult to use. Needs a much longer, far more flexible hose so the unit can remain on the floor. The suction was okay. I expected more. I'm disappointed that there's no way to judge how much mixture to make for X size jobs. I'm thinking of reheating the residual cleaning solution in the microwave and pouring back in. Not at all happy with their stain cleaning solution.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Geary

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good suction, and works well!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so last night our cat got sick (as they do) and today I got to try out the new Bissell cat barf cleaner upper. Easy to use with minimal set-up and instructions to go thru. It uses very little cleaner, which came with the unit : ) The suction was strong and it probably got 95% of the stain up, I blotted with paper towels after and the carpet looks great. Only minor complaints; it came with 2 cleaning tools, but there is no where on board the unit to store the other??? I also wished the fresh water tank showed gradient marks for half and quarter fill levels, and corresponding soap amounts....a full tank cleans a lot!
customer_reviews.author: PacNW

customer_reviews.title: Hose cracked rendering it useless & not covered under warranty!
customer_reviews.text: It worked pretty well up until the hose broke after a handful of times of use. Looks like this is the exact issue other owners who gave it a poor review had. The hose is made of a cheap quality plastic that's stiff. I called Bissell Customer Service and they said it was not covered under warranty because it is considered an internal mechanism, even though nothing internally is broken. I gave it 1 star for poor quality product and even worse customer service. I could buy a replacement hose but it's pricey and who knows how long the new one will last.
customer_reviews.author: MommaKat

customer_reviews.title: My family is MESSY
customer_reviews.text: Only used a couple times, but it worked great. Had a big red stain (fake blood from a Halloween mask) on our WHITE shaggy area rug. This son of a Bissell got it right out even after it had sat there for 6 months. Also it took some unmentionable stains out of the mattress and an old dog vomit stain from a rug. Now that I think about it, I live with a bunch of slobs. But Bissell makes life easier
customer_reviews.author: Itsrob11

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last.
customer_reviews.text: Total time of life: 4 years. Performance: when it works, it works well. However, you can't clean or replace the suction tube, which would double to triple the life span of this product. Our suction tube broke near the head/sprayer today, effectively rendering this unit useless. The cleaning and maintenance really is the other downfall of this unit. You have to clean the unit as soon as you're done using it or else everything begins to stink, the hose becomes discolored, and no amount of cleaning will seem to work after. I even tried running it through water+vinegar cleaning cycles to no avail. Good for short term, don't expect it to last for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: enigma_cipher

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME EXTRACTOR!!!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME EXTRACTOR. I just ordered this, and it works really good. I sprayed some degreaser on my seats, then sprayed the product that comes with this extractor, brushed for a little bit with a round brush for a speed drill, and then extracted. In just a few minutes, I had my 10 year old truck seats looking new again.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Unger

customer_reviews.title: Warranty NOT Honored, broke after half dozen light uses
customer_reviews.text: Warranty NOT Honored, broke after half dozen light uses and will no longer take in the liquids it sprays out. customer service is atrocious and unhelpful -- if a machine breaks with light (less than normal) use and you ask for a replacement, why not honor the terms and send out a replacement? the first 2 times the machine was used, it worked quite well, but the 3rd time it stopped taking up the liquid and it was cleaned as per manual and has never worked again. anyone have any other brands to recommend, please don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: SnS

customer_reviews.title: Hose cracked, Bissell won’t fix
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in January of 2016. Used it maybe 20 times during those 3.5 years. Went to use it today and the hose was cracked. Called Bissell and they told me the warranty is only 2 years and I should just buy a new machine. I will be buying a new machine from a company that backs their product better.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Subpar Suction
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m not impressed by the unit and the only good thing I have to say about it is that the power cord is sufficiently long. In my opinion there are two glaring issues. One is that it comes with two cleaning heads and only one storage spot (if you keep one attached to the hose) so you end up with one of the tools remaining loose, needing storage. The other issue is that the suction is awful leaving the cleaned surface fairly wet. I made sure that I only lightly sprayed the surface and the machine was still only able to extract about a third of the solution.
customer_reviews.author: GamecockFAN

customer_reviews.title: Great machine with an unreasonable design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Most about this machine is great: it's easy to use and quick to learn, and does its job well for the size and price. However, like most of the other non-five-star reviews state, if you store the hose in the spot that you're supposed to then it will very likely wear a hole through the hose within a couple years. Given that the rest of the machine will easily last far longer than that, and the hose isn't easily replaceable (my research says you have to buy a part for a different machine and work it a little), this is a frankly inexcusable design flaw for a machine that costs this much from such a major manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Bad suction even with lots of human effort.
customer_reviews.text: Had High Hopes...But this unit does not work as well as the full size Bissells I've bought in the past 20 or so years. (Although it is easy to use and cleans up more easily.) I used this on cat puke and dirty stairs. Compared to hand cleaning, this takes longer, more effort pressing down hard and repeating the motion, does not completely pick up a fresh or old stain, leaves behind water that cannot be picked up with the machine. I had my very strong, detail-oriented brother use it too. It's just not that great because it doesn't save time or effort, leaves behind stains and water. It also has a high-pitched whine. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Yack Machine
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 long hair indoor cats. I also have room sized area rugs that are basically white. Anyone who has cats knows that they yack a lot, and that they always move to the rug to deposit their yack. I call this my Cat Yack Machine. It is light weight and easy to move around. It is great for cleaning up after my cats. There are no telltale signs that any of my rugs have been yacked on, even though they all have been yacked on multiple times. Let me tell you -- this little Bissell works! As a matter of fact, it works so well that we bought 2 so that we have one upstairs and one downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Blue911

customer_reviews.title: Nice cleaner but.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cleaner based on recommendations from YouTube channels and would have been used to primarily clean vehicle interiors. PROS: 1. Nice suction and easy to use 2. Dirty water removal is easy CONS A couple of negatives and this is why I deducted a star from my review: 1. No optional wheels to cart around the garage as you move around the vehicle...you have to carry the unit everywhere you go 2. Attached hose is too short I've used this unit for about a month.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in May of 2014 and yesterday, the hose tore where it attaches to the hand tool. When I called to find out the cost of repair, I was told it will be more than half of the purchase price of a new one. I called Bissell customer service, who asked me if I'd just consider buying the newer model, to which I replied probably not since two years of light use is not a great product testimony. I can't recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: This seemed like the perfect solution for spot cleaning area rugs and ...
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like the perfect solution for spot cleaning area rugs and auto carpet stains. After using for the first time recently, I was surprised how little suction the vacuum had. The only thing it seems to do well is spraying the cleaning solution onto the carpet and making a LOT of noise. Vacuum removes very little cleaning solution. Requires scrubbing with the included suction head and single row of bristles. Could have done the same thing with a stiff bristle brush and a bucket of soapy water. Had to hang the rug outside in the sun to fully dry. Will be returning product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Great suction and portable.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for upholstery. I also agree with other buyers that it makes sense to keep a bucket of clean water nearby to clean out the machine/hose once in a while during a large project. Also, recommend suctioning out water thoroughly from light colored upholstery/fabrics to avoid water stains. Finally, if you start to lose suction strength, empty out the dirty water. Great machine overall.
customer_reviews.author: Miki S.

customer_reviews.title: I thought my couch was clean
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I think this may be my new favorite thing. I used it on my couch that I have had about a year. No kids, but two dogs. Man, I did not realize how dirty it was! I vacuum regularly, so I was surprised how dirty it actually was. I can not wait to try this in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Lexington Crupper

customer_reviews.title: Short Hose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my carpets because we just got a puppy and he has been peeing. It works really well however there are some downsides. The hose is really short so you always have to have the machine super close to you. The sprayer sprays 180 degrees which can be a little annoying when I’m trying to get a small area and I want a direct spray. I have to go over the other area too because the water just comes out. I was expecting the machine to be a bit bigger when I got it but it still does the job. But all in all it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: HOSE ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: I have not used mine enough for the hose to crack and break. And it's not easily replaced. Not sure if there's another one any better. With my animals it was easy to clean up after them when needed, but it just didn't last. Bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret F.

customer_reviews.title: Stay far far away
customer_reviews.text: Used Bissell Pro OXY Spot & Stain in machine. Ruined our chair. Turned it yellow. Stay far away if you’re using on furniture. Now we get to pay $200 for a cleaning company to come (hopefully) save our chairs. Update - 1.5 hour phone call (worst customer service experience I’ve ever had- couldn’t even speak English) we have to wait for paperwork to come in the mail to file a complaint. STAY AWAY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: NatiRoots

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: This shampooer works wonderfully. Pros: -Powerful suction removes stains and most of the water leaving carpet spotless and only slightly damp -Long cord and lightweight for portability -Large water reservoirs that are easy to empty, clean out, and refill Cons: -Very loud -No rotator brush meaning you have to do all of the scrubbing yourself
customer_reviews.author: Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Add me to the list of people with a broken hose.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great until the hose breaks and makes it completely useless. And based on the other reviews no one is willing to help.
customer_reviews.author: KnitTuck

customer_reviews.title: Short Lived
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, my Bissell Spot Clean Pro only worked for two years. I used it maybe 5 times. I took very good care if it and cleaned it out carefully after each use. It was practically new. I would not recommend buying this item. I went to a local vacuum store and they told me that these are pretty much disposable. Save your money and invest in a better product. I bought the Royal Pro Series upright for $299....too bad I didn't have the money I'd wasted on this to put towards that.
customer_reviews.author: Native Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: First job I did was rear cloth seats in my 2013 Toyota Camry. Cannot believe how much dirt this made in the USA cleaner got out! wow! See image of clear glass of water on left, and the dirty water the vac extracted from these rarely sat in seats on this car. The front seats will be much dirtier no doubt. Will post updated photo of front seat water when that is collected tomorrow. Can't clean front seats now, as car is being loaned to guests for the weekend, takes a few days for seats to dry. Excellent product and money well spent. Unit looks well built and best of all, made in the USA by Bissell!
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I just got around to using my Bissell SpotClean Pro Portable I purchased Dec. 2014...I purchased this used with only cosmetic scratches. It absolutely does not spray! Husband and I spent hours reviewing online manual for this model and could not make it work. We took every imaginable part apart as suggested, to no avail. So, my bad for not trying out this purchase, right away; particularly when product is used. I know it is too late to return but is seller willing to work with me on trouble-shooting or providing another model? Buyer be ware: do NOT wait too long to test out purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cece R.

customer_reviews.title: Lack of suction power. Simply doesn’t do what it should.
customer_reviews.text: It is so hard to find a credible review of this type of machine. Wirecutter’s is not one - they are probably “reimbursed”. The suction power hardly pulls my shirtsleeve away from my arm. It seems to pull some liquid from the carpet fibers, but certainly not deep down. I have tried a hoover upright and now this. You are far better off to buy a wet/dry vac from the orange hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: This cleaner is amazing!! I had the green Bissell Spot Bot ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG!! This cleaner is amazing!! I had the green Bissell Spot Bot for years, and used it til it's death! I was about to purchase another one, and then saw this baby. Thanks to all the reviews, I ended up getting it. It's sooo much better than the other one. Like other reviewers have stated, the dirty water container is so easy to clean, and the suction is very strong! I read the negative comments on the hose cracking, so I'm just not going to roll it up when I put it away.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Quality, convenience, performance
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient and easy to use, clean and maintain. Perfect for pet mishaps which has been all I’ve used it for at this point. Thankfully I don’t need to use it regularly but when I do need it, it’s very easy to get ready, use and clean. Smart design! I’ve had none of the issues that other reviewers have with leaking (although I do usually empty and clean it immediately after use) or the hose detaching but I’m pretty careful with my stuff. The unit does a great job cleaning! Very happy with this spot cleaner!
customer_reviews.author: Mdspurbe

customer_reviews.title: The hose is garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these in the past 4 years, and have experienced the same unfortunate results with both. The hose is always the first thing to go. I have never been rough with this spot cleaner, and have always treated it with care. The hose will break at the handle first. After you tape it up to seal it, the hose will break again where your tape ends. This is a huge inconvenience and design flaw, as there is no way to just replace the hose. Eventually your hose will just be 5 ft. of duct tape, and will never wrap up to be put away properly again. I guess you could say this vacuum sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia DeGagne

customer_reviews.title: carpets are disgusting
customer_reviews.text: I am disgusted that I was walking barefoot on carpets that made water That Black and disgusting. Mind you these are just plain area rugs all less than 6 months old - we do have pets. I will never, ever never again live in a house with full floor carpets after what I saw in one afternoon with this little beast. After I washed the rugs with this bissel, it took about 1.5 hour and two tank fills, my spouse walked in and mentioned how clean everything looks. This is a person who never notices this kind of thing. I'm very very impressed. My car is next, and my friends have already lined up to borrow it also
customer_reviews.author: AvgConsumer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE PROVIDED HOSE HOLDER!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great little machine and I loved it until I discovered that the hose had cracked from me using the provided hose holder. I used it infrequently, so I only got maybe 20 uses out of it before the hose cracked and rendered it useless. I contacted Bissell and they refused to repair it because I was outside of the 2 year warranty. I'm saddened that they didn't make an exception since this is an issue caused by the storage they provided on the machine. I'll never buy a Bissell product again, they do not stand by their products.
customer_reviews.author: Jill D

customer_reviews.title: Giving it 4 starts for now...
customer_reviews.text: I got this spot cleaner because I needed to clean my couch that my 20 month old likes to spill everything on. I tried it today and it worked pretty good. It comes with a little bottle of solution to clean with. So that's nice. I had a hard time using the spray cause it kept on going everywhere around the couch and the floor. I think I'm just bad at it. It took about a day to dry off. The water was all black and gross after I was done with so it definitely cleaned. It was easy to figure out how to use. I will post pics of before and after.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, but needs a few improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit to cleanup pet stains. Works great, but there are some improvements needed to make this machine worth 5 starts. First and foremost, this unit needs a built in heater. Yes, you put hot water in, but after working a few stains the water cools down and loses its cleaning effectiveness. Secondly, the unit needs a longer hose. If you have a full flight of 12 or 13 stairs you will need to place the unit on one of the stairs, which is a bit challenging. Finally, the unit needs a rinse only feature. The unit is a great purchase for the money and I have not run into a stain it could not handle.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in a day
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to try to get cat urine odor out of a couch. I used the pet enzyme cleaner and, three rounds later, it's saved. I had previously tried a half dozen different pet cleaners with towels and scrubbers but the Bissell made all the difference. I've since revived some severely neglected lounge chairs that have been taken over by cats. Also rescued our new all carpet from a couple of pet accidents (it supposedly voids the warranty to use this on wool carpet but after paying $150/incident to have the professionals out with mixed results, I decided to do it myself). Recommend buying this or getting rid of your cats.
customer_reviews.author: Aaroneous

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaner, agree with hose design problem
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews concerning hose design and agree that if time is not taken to put the hose back to its storage position that it will create a problem. However, what I do like about this model is the large opening when emptying the dirty water tank. It makes it fast and easy to clean when finished. Does a great job cleaning stains also. I have a cat that gets sick a it with hair Alla, etc. and it picks up quickly
customer_reviews.author: payrez

customer_reviews.title: Greatly Improved Over Older Models
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Bissell wet vac which finally died after many years of awesome service. My biggest complaint about the old model was the difficulty cleaning it, especially the dirty water collection reservoir - the insides were just not accessible enough to get all the dirt out and it would get more and more dirty over time. Bissell has made a lot of improvements since then and this model is much easier to clean. Other improvements are how the cord and hose are wound up. I wish more companies would listen to their customers and improve their products the way Bissell does!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jones

customer_reviews.title: It worked great when I first bought it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for about four years. It worked great when I first bought it. But after about three years, the hose became very brittle and cracked. I was able to fix it with duct tape, but it kept cracking in more places. It cracked at the base of the hose, where it attached to the body of the machine, rendering it non-functional. They do not sale replacement hoses, meaning this machine is toast after a few short years. Very bad design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for my SUV Upholstery
customer_reviews.text: It works great for my SUV. If you have deep stains i recommend putting the cleaning solution in a spray bottle and soak the area first. Maybe even use a degreaser for upholstery. Use hot water too. Used only once so far for my SUV seats. Will update as time goes by. So far the plastic feels strong enough to last. Would've liked a motorized circular brush instead of manually brushing the stains.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Poor hose design , will crack!
customer_reviews.text: Poor hose design, wanna replace every 2 years for $40? I purchased this based on the reviews, it is a powerful little machine and does a great job cleaning up spots. I purchased two years ago and almost to the day the hose split where it connects to the body. Thought about ordering a house replacement but for $40 a pop may just get the Green Machine instead for $100. Wish Bissell would provide a sturdier hose. Wanted to love this machine but for a hose to only last a couple of years with light use, I have to rate it two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Techblukat

customer_reviews.title: Pictures are worth a thousand words
customer_reviews.text: I'm leaving images of how disgusting my chairs looked, second pic is of the chair once washed and last pic once they dried. Each chair dried by the time I was completely done with the next one. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it's past the time I would have had to return this item. I purchased and it remained boxed for an extended period of time before using. Once I did use it, I realized that the tube in the solution container exceeds the water line of the solution, so you don't really get any solution spray on the carpet making it very ineffective and useless.
customer_reviews.author: ntheflow

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Did not work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an alternative to having my upholstered chair and carpet professionally cleaned. I thought that this would save me money because I'd have it for the long haul. I was wrong. First, this did not get any stains out of my upholstered chair. I followed the directions, and even did 2 separate cleanings. Stains did not come out sadly. Same on carpet. Somewhat better results, but did not completely lift stains. It does smell nice, and I'm sure that it removed dust, etc. But if you're thinking this will magically lift all stains, and opting for this vice getting professional cleaning done, think again. Just food for thought.
customer_reviews.author: Latham

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated and upset consumer!!
customer_reviews.text: This product did not even last 1 year before it began givibg trouble. It is not spraying out ant water. And i have been told that i cannot get a return as my return window has been closed. This is upsetting. I will not recommend purchasing this product from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela King-oblington

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use all in one
customer_reviews.text: On the recommendation of a car detailer I purchased this specific cleaner. I purchased it for cleaning my car. I have used it in the home already as well tried it out on a piece of furniture. It is easy to use very compact and durable. The price is very fair in comparison to what the big box stores offer. I would have liked a longer house but with it being portable I can understand why it is made this way. Overall I highly recommend this machine. Cost ease of use and being compact are reasons for a positive review.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Hose Broke
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the hose will break eventually. I have used this less than 15 times since purchasing it, and the damn thing tore near the handle. Definitely not worth the money I paid for it. There is no way to replace the hose, and I think this is deliberate (produced for the trashcan so you have to buy another one). Otherwise, the build quality is such that this would have lasted another 10 years easily if the hose were replaceable. I know this has really good reviews, but most people just review the product right after they get it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a life changer!!! We did 90% of our home hardwood but we put brand new silver carpet in the main living room and our babies room. We used this little guy to clean out couch, mattresses and spots on our carpet. This thing is AMAZING!!!! I used the oxy detergent and added some lavender essential oil to the water. Very happy with this purchase! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works decently well. NOT a steam cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a wet vac with a water sprayer built in. Do not expect every stain to come right out. Basic procedure is to spray down the area with the nozzle attached to the vacuum head (add your own WARM water and included soap solution), scrub using the brush on the nozzle, and then vacuum up. My fault for not reading enough in depth and expecting a steam type cleaner. Spilled some cream based soup on my seat, and it took 3 good sessions to get the smell and stain completely removed.
customer_reviews.author: Giselle

customer_reviews.title: Love my portable deep cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Got this portable cleaner for spot cleaning on furniture. We have a few small dogs and they have accidents........ so we needed something to keep up with them. This works great! I am very happy with this machine. I read the reviews and care instructions prior to use and purchase. I do not use the hose holder to ensure I do not get a hole in it. I also clean the machine after use as instructed. I do not see how a person can think they are going to clean something with a dirty tool as I read in the limited poorer rating. So for me it is an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Liz in PA

customer_reviews.title: Love this little machine!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is an absolute MUST HAVE for anyone with kids! It's cleaned my light cream microfiber couches better than the pro cleaners I've hired (I actually had someone ask if we bought new couches after using it for the first time......and the couches were actually pretty clean prior)! I live being able to touch up (or deep clean) as often as I like. I buy a huge jug of Folex (amazing product for cleaning upholstery or carpets) and cut it with a small amount of warm water in the tank. I can't believe I've lived this long without this little machine! So far haven't had any problems with the hose. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: A Mom's best friend
customer_reviews.text: Okay guys, but do you see what my kids did to my barely 3 year old sofa?? I bought this to do my car after watching a detailing guy on YT use it. I hadn't gotten a chance to use it for that yet so I did a test run on my poor sofa and this thing is AMAZING. Setting it up was super easy and fast and it cleaned my cushion sooo good! I obviously need to do a 2nd run but that's my fault because I wasn't doing it in a fully lit room and didn't see the spots I missed. I can't wait to tackle my whole sofa this weekend and then my car! :D
customer_reviews.author: haley

customer_reviews.title: Great product for deep cleaning car interiors, and furniture.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to seat both the water and extracted containers. Did not premix any cleaning chemicals in the resevior, only warm tap water. A light cleaning with some soaps from a spray bottle a drill brush to lift and then the runs and extraction pass with the Spot Cleaner. Its got significantly more suction than my upright carpet cleaner with a wand attachment. The units also compact, easy to move, and has a long powecord and fairly long reach from its base. Top product, and super useful. Cheaper to buy this than to get the car detailed once.
customer_reviews.author: Cms10

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend created an even worse mess.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog who has reached the age where accidents happen. I had hoped this spot cleaner would be able to keep her small messes cleaned up, unfortunately that is not the case. The machine seems to actually create an even bigger mess because it leaks from the intake hose. This means all of the dirty yucky stuff being sucked out of the carpet mixed with water is leaking right back out then as I carry the machine across the floor the hose is dripping the nasty waste all over the place. It appears that the hose is actually split.
customer_reviews.author: Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Fairly happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I was super bummed to find out that the spot bot part of this newer version, iiiis no longer a spot bot. I really miss the setting it over a stain and telling it to go. It only has the two hand attachments. There are some things I like about it. I like the larger compartments for the fluids so I'm not emptying it so much. I like that the hose wraps better on this version. My older version broke from those hard angles of wrapping. I like that it's easy to carry. But yeah, miss the actual spot bot features a lot with the 3 cats and 2 dogs. Bring it back Bissell!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Dirty Water Vessel Leaked on my Couch
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this vacuum around 10 times since I purchased it, and I just realized that the seal on the dirty water tank completely failed (glue came off and the vessel separated) and dirty water leaked all over my couch. I just tried cleaning it again, so I'm hoping that when everything dries, it's not ruined. Besides this instance, I haven't been impressed with this product. The vacuum feature doesn't seem very strong, as it still takes hours for surfaces to dry after applying even a fine mist of water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hose falls apart after a couple months
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this unit but the hose is a pos. It’s breaking apart at the end and has gotten so stiff I can no longer roll it around the holder. I should have read more reviews as this is a very common issue. Called the service center and it costs as much to replace hose as a brand new unit!
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I take my truck on backcountry roads nearly every weekend. The dogs join too. Even with blankets and towels, the seats still get filthy. I always used the TurtleWax upholstery cleaner, which did a good job for what it is; but some spots and stains just wouldn't come out . . . Despite the price point I bought this thing given the reviews. It worked great. Every spot and stain came out. It was easy to use and easy to pour out the grime -- just remove the waste bucket when finished, pull the handle back all the way, and the top comes off.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Glassman

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My upholstered chairs were looking pretty bad from my kids messes. I thought I’d give this a try instead of replacing them. It worked great. Didn’t take too much time. I did one pass with noticeable difference. I ended up doing about 4 passes with one pass letting the solution sit without suctioning it up. I let the solution sit for 5 minutes and went back. The suction power is great. After a 3-4 hours I went to check if it was still wet, but it was all dry. This will probably be great in the car as well.
customer_reviews.author: Myra

customer_reviews.title: The clean water squirts out fine, but it picked up nothing
customer_reviews.text: This thing does NOT work. I vacuumed my rug- TWICE- with my Oreck vacuum- then went to use this. Followed ALL of the instructions exactly. The clean water squirts out fine, but it picked up nothing. NOT ONE OUNCE of dirty water in the dirty water tank, but the clean water tank is empty. Horrible product and the people at Bissel's 800# were useless.
customer_reviews.author: Sbee

customer_reviews.title: clever compact design, lots of suction, cleans well
customer_reviews.text: clever compact design, lots of suction, cleans well. the design tolerances are a bit tight, though. you have to squeeze the sides a bit when lifting the locking handle for the used water and also squeeze the clean water container when putting it back into the device. i suppose it will loosen up over time. generally, amazing job of cleaning! much better than an upright machine for getting out spots. one tank of fresh soap and water cleaned about 25 square feet of berber style carpet. it only filled up about 1/3 of the used water tank, so I guess you could do 2 or 3 parts of the floor before dumping the used water.
customer_reviews.author: Tek2000

customer_reviews.title: Comes with the wrong bissell sample be careful and check that before try it in you machine
customer_reviews.text: I get the portable bissell spotclean pro and it comes with a sample for some reason the sample said that didn’t use it with a portable machine just with a upright carpet cleaners but it supposed comes with the machine to use it with the machine and I almost try it and noticed that so be careful because it said it can damage your product and will void the 2 years warranty so I don’t understand why it comes with the machine... I tried it today and worked very good I recommend this product for cleaning cars and for a fast car toddler car seal cleaning
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful home upholstery cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: You have to try it to believe it. There were some stains that were pretty sunk into a rug in our living room. I used the soap it comes with to pre soak and then followed with the rug cleaner. It is kinda loud, but the suction is great. I could see all the dirty water in the container and it was proof that my rug is filthy eventhough I vacuum it weekly. The stain came out and my rug looks great now. Then I also used it on my couches and they feel fresher now.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: to me its worth $80
customer_reviews.text: It works nice. I can use it for the car. The main reason I got it. For house its good for stairs... If it cost less I would go 5 stars. update. I used it on my car and my computer room rugs. Most people don't seem to know when you take the dirty water out you pull the handle backwards over the high end to unluck the latch and then the top comes off......But then I had a gallon of really dirty water, yea it worked great. But when I poured it all into the tub it splashed up and out of the tub and went everywhere. So I am sticking with 4 stars out of anger.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Stiff competition to a professional steam cleaning service!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! I literally just steam cleaned 2 couches and 3 chairs. We are talking disgusting toddler food ground into a chair and couch that smelled like a smelly wet dog. I usually have all my furniture professionally steam cleaned twice a year but with COVID-19 I really wasn’t sure when that was going to happen and I was going nuts! It did the job SO well. Even got out a wine stain on my white chair! So glad I purchased!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kyleigh

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is is pretty useless. It gets a point for being cute and compact, beyond that it's a no-go. The unit is extremely noisy, yet the suction is astonishingly weak. Essentially a glorified, very loud soap sprayer. It takes time to clean the tanks and hoses nicely after use. The old way, with a pail of soapy water, a soft brush, and a shop vac is far more effective and cheaper. So long cute toy....off to the swap shop.
customer_reviews.author: Afax

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. This bulky, expensive machine’s only automatic function is to suck up water, a task that can be accomplished by a shop vac or blotting with a Turkish towel. You are required to spray and hand scrub the carpet. Cleaning out the machine and drying it before storing it is the major pain. I’m sending mine back.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Perry

customer_reviews.title: Best life decision ever!
customer_reviews.text: This machine has been more of a lifesaver than I could've ever imagined! I normally have pros AND cons for products that I purchase, but definitely only PRO's for this. If you have a pet, you NEED this in your life!
customer_reviews.author: JPGriffyn

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to remove dirty water tank, makes it unusable... poor design
customer_reviews.text: It is virtually impossible to get the dirty water tank out... And if you tried to clean it, oh my goodness. We have tried to reconnect it and it’s almost like it’s broken. Just very poorly designed. My husband, son and I all tried in vain. Can’t recommend it because now we can’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for our pet stains.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Used it to clean up a mess on our couch cushion. Something that had sat in for a few days and we had used resolve cleaner on it and it did not get any better. We tried this cleaner on it with the added sample included. And the stain looked 10 times better than it did with other cleaners. We still had quite a bit of water left in our tank so we cleaned our ottoman and I didn’t realize how dirty it was until then. Would definitely recommend has worked well so far with our pet stains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, awesome cleaning power  and super light.
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 dogs. Accidents happen, a LOT! Rather than lug my Bissell full size machine up the stairs for just a small spot, I just grab this little guy and tackle the mess. It’s suctioning power is great, it’s easy to fill and just as easy to empty. Best of all, I can place only a small amount of water and cleaning solution into it for small jobs. I tackled my vehicle’s cloth seats with this machine and it did a great job on those as well. I haven’t used it on the couch yet but with as many dogs as I have, it’s just a matter of time...
customer_reviews.author: KURT H LINDGREN

customer_reviews.title: This cleans great!
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this cleaner. My first project was 2 outdoor couches that my dogs had soiled with muddy paws, it did the trick, looked and smelled new when I was finished, next I tackled the sectional inside, once again like new when finished, I took on my carpet in my SUV after that, this was a bigger job, several years of spilled drinks from kids along with dirt, now it did a good job but I will need to give it another once over to get it like new, I really like this cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: chris caskey

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum pump is worthless!
customer_reviews.text: Exhausts through the bottom so blocked when sitting on carpet, you need to set it on a rack. Cleaned a short nap 3x5 cut pile rug, extracted slowly three times then hung the rug over the rail next my wood stove to dry. Walked by 5 minutes later and was big puddle on floor I had to soak up with large towel. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed all expectations after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: First review 9 + months of ownership with heavy usage.. still amazing! Seriously this gem is on stand by 24/7 as many as six clean ups a single day. Extremely portable, easy to carry, has never leaked!! Other machines in past have leaked. Hose has never cracked. Love it. We were just saying how this may be the single best amazon purchase we’ve ever made. Thus this review...
customer_reviews.author: BigSky

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for spot cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little machine. It is for spot-cleaning only but does a great job. If you've got family members prone to spills, or the occasional pet accident, this is a nice home tool to have. It's easy to set up and use and the motor is powerful enough to extract the water. If you're doing several areas you may be making a few more trips to the sink if you want to keep the reservoir full of hot water. But, I've found it does a good job as the water moved toward room temperature. It's typical vacuum cleaner loud - ear protection isn't required but your pets may opt to lounge in another room.
customer_reviews.author: JRausta

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. I bought this to start off our detailing business because of the amazing reviews. I’m not sure if mine was defective but it took out minimal stains, it basically only removed the agitated shampoo. I used it on one car and the second time I used it it completely broke half way. It stopped suctioning little by little and even stopped throwing water. Extremely dissatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upholstery
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to clean vintage chairs, so I bought this having never used anything like it before. Setup was easy. It comes with cleaning fluid. Assembly is a snap. It works pretty well! The dirty water goes in its own canister and is fairly easy to clean out. It is a bit loud when using, so I use earplugs. It's also a bit messy, so use it on a floor that can be easily cleaned up or a surface you don't mind getting wet. Clean it after every use and you're golden. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: The Bull

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT -- ear splittingly LOUD
customer_reviews.text: New house + 4kids + 2 dogs + 2 kids = not new looking carpet for long. Bought this for spots that just seem to happen on a regular basis. So far -- this thing has been a champ. My dog had a massive HORRIBLE accident during the night ALL OVER our bedroom carpet. We used this to clean and it came out beautifully. Kids have spilled lots of things -- this cleans it up. Highly recommend and the soap that comes with it seems to work well. Suction is good -- water pulls out very well. No over-damp carpet when finished. This is extremely LOUD - so I gave it 4 stars. Hate that about it. But it works...
customer_reviews.author: PololvrTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast as long as your problem is pretty small
customer_reviews.text: This little beast drips a bit and sounds like an overclocked battle tank, but it actually works really well. With the right cleaner and patience, I got the couch much better. It's just the ticket for cat hairballs and various spills. It's been going for years and years, too, across three moves, two countries, and countless stains. If it was a little more powerful and did a little more carpet at a time, I'd give it five stars. For small messes, though, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul L. Finan

customer_reviews.title: Great product, be aware with hose.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this machine for my automotive detail business for over two years now. No replacement parts have been needed and the tool works great. Has worked great on small messes around the house too. A lot of negative reviews on the hose, long as you know that the hose is weak and don’t kink it and just be careless with it. You’ll be fine and it will work every time. Cleaning the machine is the worst part once it starts to get a smell, but about once every 6 months I clean it out thoroughly and it takes about 45 minutes. Overall very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Payton

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine. It does a pretty decent job at cleaning. I wish it had a power head though with moving bristles. You could essentially get the same cleaning with a spray bottle a scrub brush and a shop vac. You have to vigorously scrub with this to get any stains out. It can be pretty tiring. Great portability though. I was able to do our entire staircase and the Bissell sat nicely on each step and I never felt like it was about to fall.
customer_reviews.author: CoreyJ

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: YouTube channel “the detail geek” praises this product like no other. I think they should endorse him. I’ve seen what this guy does multiple times with this small machine. He’s recommended this in all his videos so I’ve gave it a try and it’s AMAZING!! I only put water in it no cleaning products since I spayed the carpet with my cleaner and used a drill brush to agitate the area I’m cleaning. The hot water and suction does the rest. Highly recommend this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Krystle s.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean my furniture. Like every fabric cleaning product, it says to test first. I didn’t because I’m impatient. My furniture is tan colored and it had stains from spilled juice and god knows what else; 5 year olds tend to be messy. This cleaner is exactly what I needed! It cleaned everything beautifully. I did one sofa at a time to allow drying in between cleanings. I allowed my sofas to dry over night and by the next morning they loooked like new. I’m super happy. The machine is very easy to use, I briefly glanced at the instructions and jumped right in. I’m adding a few before and after shots.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

product_meta.title: Bissell 3624 SpotClean Professional Portable Carpet Cleaner - Corded
product_meta.description: Style Name:SpotCleanThe Bissell SpotClean Pro Portable Carpet Cleaner is our most powerful spot and stain cleaner. It uses a combination of superior suction, scrubbing action and specially formulated Bissell cleaning solutions to remove spots, stubborn stains and embedded dirt. This compact, 13-pound machine is easy to take to hard-to-reach areas, so you can remove spot and stains from carpets, area rugs, stairs, upholstery, auto interiors, and similar soft surfaces. It comes with a 6" Stair Tool, 3" Tough Stain Tool and a trial-size bottle of our Pro Max Clean + Protect formula to permanently remove tough pet stains. And it doesn't just clean up after pets, this machine helps save them, too! Bissell proudly supports Bissell Pet Foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets. When you buy a Bissell product, you help save pets too. We’re proud to design products that help make pet messes, odors and pet homelessness disappear.
feature_bullets: Every Bissell purchase helps save pets. Bissell proudly supports Bissell pet foundation and its mission to help save homeless pets.
Our most powerful portable spot and stain cleaner for carpets, stairs, upholstery, auto interiors, and more.
Combines superior suction, scrubbing action and professional cleaning solution to remove stubborn pet stains, embedded dirt and more.
Provides a deep clean that leaves you with professional-style results.
Permanently removes tough messes and protects from future stains with the power of stain protect.
Includes a 6" Stair Tool, which makes cleaning stairs easy. Also comes with a 3" Tough Stain Tool and a trial-size bottle of Pro Max clean + protect formula.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars9,293 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
